content.description:
Belay from the obvious brush clearing in the boulder field. Climb up onto the ledge and traverse left over balancey moves to the crack. Smearing and lie-backing mainly, with a few feet out left. Crack is fat fingers down low, small hands up top. Plug some gear under the roof, and move up and over the roof (crux). Don't get stuck trying to place pro in the awkward stance above the roof. Keep moving. The pro thins out from roof to anchors.

Super fun, albeit short, route!

Descent:

Clean your anchor and walk off left.
content.protection: Can easily set up a toprope (directional cam suggested). Small rack up to 2". BD#2 protects roof. Bolts with some very weathered slings/rap ring attached.
content.location: When standing in the parking area, right under and looking up at the aquarium, head left down the draw to the west. Follow a light trail for about 200 yards until you see the climb on your right. Can't miss it.

content.description:
Belay from the obvious clearing in the boulder field below the route. Climb up onto the ledge. Super fun lie-back moves, jams, and a few feet out right. Crux is about 1/2 way up.

Descent:

Walk off left.
content.protection: Takes small fingers to fat hands up to 3". Bolts with some very weathered slings and rap ring attached.
content.location: When standing in the parking area, right under and looking up at the aquarium, head left down the draw to the west. Follow a light trail for about 200 yards until you see the climb on your right. Can't miss it.

content.description: (Also known as Peace Pipe) In the back of the aquarium this route ascends a steep face that is littered with small crimps and sidepulls.  Grunt your way through 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: As you come over the lip of the fourth class and drop down into the central Aquarium this route is on the right wall above a large ramp.
